image.altText: Three little penguins bunched together on sand

props.synopsis: The small, fragile colony of surviving little penguins on South Australia's Granite Island records a "significant increase" in numbers amid the state's harmful algal bloom.

title.children: Little penguin numbers increase on Granite Island despite algal bloom

image.altText: A sign reading Yatala Labour Prison behind blurred greenery

props.synopsis: A prisoner was taken to the hospital after the second alleged violent assault in two weeks in the South Australian prison system.

title.children: Nine prisoners attacked inmate in latest SA prison assault, union says

image.altText: A worker at support service Orana.

props.synopsis: Some in the disability employment sector say they are operating in an increasingly complex and changing environment, and that there is a need for a clear way forward for organisations supporting people with complex needs.

title.children: Calls for road map for disability employment providers to meet growing push to transform

image.altText: A smartphone with an Airbnb logo on it in front of the same logo being projected on a screen.

props.synopsis: A council in South Australia wants to charge short-stay rentals such as AirBnBs at a higher rate, saying they act as businesses.

title.children: SA council considers classing short-stay rentals as businesses

image.altText: Warren Tredrea and Mark Williams lift premiership cup

props.synopsis: The Port Adelaide Football Club continues to describe Warren Tredrea as one of its greatest-ever players — but on Friday it dismissed him from its board of directors.

title.children: Warren Tredrea was the Power's premiership captain, but has now been booted from its board

image.altText: Police including two armed with large guns, behind a table full of drugs, cash and firearms.

props.synopsis: An international covert sting linked to the encrypted AN0M platform which brought down hundreds of alleged criminals and netted cash, drugs and weapons has reached a new phase.

title.children: 'Unprecedented' Operation Ironside sting enters new era

image.altText: A Sydney Swans AFLW player and an Essendon opponent contest for the ball.

props.synopsis: Daisy Pearce's West Coast Eagles have reached the AFLW finals for the first time after the Sydney Swans blew their chance in a shock three-point loss to struggling Essendon at Coffs Harbour.

title.children: Eagles to make historic AFLW finals appearance after Swans fall to Bombers

image.altText: An over the shoulder shot of two women looking at an old letter.

props.synopsis: Sixty years ago in Canada, 12-year-old Diane Hatt went searching for a pen pal in Australia. She found one in South Australian Joy Doevendans and they've become best friends.

title.children: Pen pals for 60 years, Joy and Diane live on opposite sides of the world

image.altText: A view of the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

props.synopsis: The Australasian College of Emergency Medicine says on a day in September there were 70 admitted inpatients in the Royal Adelaide Hospital's emergency department that has 68 beds — a claim disputed by SA Health.

title.children: Emergency doctors say RAH admitted more patients than bed limit, SA Health denies claim

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say "nothing of significance" was found after a dam was drained on Friday in a search for missing four-year-old Gus that was undertaken "out of an abundance of caution".

title.children: No sign of missing 4yo after dam drained, SA police say

image.altText: The old Snowtown bank.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Parole Administrative Review Commissioner will start hearing submissions in December as to why Snowtown killer James Vlassakis should not be released on parole.

title.children: Commissioner to hear submissions on why Snowtown killer should not get parole

image.altText: A smiling man stands near a beach with a black top and cap

props.synopsis: Six months ago, Jack Atkinson had little running experience. But this weekend he will tackle the world's largest marathon alongside NRL great Johnathan Thurston and AFL giant Lance 'Buddy' Franklin.

title.children: SA runner to join NRL, AFL greats at New York Marathon

image.altText: A sign that reads algal bloom in south australia, visiting the beach is safe, in front of a sandy and grassy beach

props.synopsis: Coastal towns in parts of SA's south-east have seen significant drops in visitation, despite being free of harmful algae.

title.children: SA coastal tourism down, even in towns without algae

image.altText: A tradie buying and renovating homes at a home inspection

props.synopsis: Australia's property market is heating up again, with record auctions over spring, and the return of both first home buyers and investors pushing up house prices.

title.children: Australia's home prices surge at highest rate in more than two years in October

image.altText: Shafali Verma runs off in celebration towards Harmanpreet Kaur

props.synopsis: All-round performances from Deepti Sharma and Shafali Verma have led India to a breakthrough World Cup triumph against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.

title.children: India claims maiden World Cup title with epic victory over South Africa

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

title.children: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k

image.altText: An armed guard standing outside the glass entrance to the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four thieves raided the world's most-visited art museum last month, in broad daylight, taking just seven minutes to steal jewellery worth an estimated $150 million before fleeing on scooters.

title.children: Louvre heist suspects believed to be small-time criminals

image.altText: A fireman holding a hose and putting out a fire in a charred building.

props.synopsis: At least two people have been killed in a drone attack in Ukraine's south-western Odesa region, and Kyiv has stepped up its attacks on Russia's oil industry.

title.children: Russian drones kill Ukrainians and Kyiv targets Moscow's oil

image.altText: A jockey looks to his right and smiles as he rides his horse towards the line in the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup, 20 years ago.

title.children: 'A nation roars': The Makybe Diva threepeat 20 years on

image.altText: Canavan speaks in a courtyard surrounded by a crowd of politicians.

props.synopsis: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.

title.children: 'Found our voice': Nationals abandon net zero by 2050 climate promise

image.altText: A young woman prepares to do a snatch lift, she has a strained look on her face.

props.synopsis: Teenager Mira Mohan, and Francee and Carolyn, both in their 60s, are changing the face of weightlifting, showing it is a sport for women at any stage of life.

title.children: No longer invisible, weightlifting is empowering women of all ages

image.altText: Man with blonde hair wearing one earring.

props.synopsis: A man charged with the domestic violence murder of 39-year-old Hunter woman Rhukaya Lake is remanded in custody.

title.children: Man refused bail over accused murder of woman near Cessnock

image.altText: Father and son celebrate after finishing yacht race.

props.synopsis: It has been almost 20 years since Ken Gourlay became the fastest Australian to sail solo, non-stop and unassisted around the world. Now, his son is aiming to break the record.

title.children: 'What could a man want better?': Sailing legend hopes his record falls to his son

image.altText: Mojito mocktail

props.synopsis: Having a range of drinks on offer can help everyone feel included, especially at end-of-year gatherings.

title.children: Raise a glass to these easy low and no-alcohol drinks

image.altText: Kirsha Kaechele

props.synopsis: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

title.children: Why the 'first lady' of MONA has always felt like an outsider

image.altText: Children's toys including a giraffe inside a car and an abacus.

props.synopsis: The decision by past governments to push Australia's childcare industry in the direction of marketisation and corporatisation has left a lasting legacy.

title.children: Australia's scandal-ridden childcare sector a legacy of 'golden age' of reform

image.altText: Person waiting at lights on an fat tyre ebike

props.synopsis: Noticing a lot of e-bikes around lately? Here's a state-by-state breakdown of the laws about them.

title.children: What is the difference between an e-bike and an e-motorbike?

image.altText: An edited image showing a horse removed from the picture during the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

title.children: How racing makes its deadliest moments disappear

image.altText: A graphic of playing cards falling through a basketball net

props.synopsis: The New York mafia is alive and an "historic" FBI bust has shown that underworld crime is still kicking across the United States.

title.children: New York's underbelly is thriving — this FBI case pulled back the curtain

image.altText: Dozens of tents pitched on the foreshore with the ocean waves in the background.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it offered to hand over samples of the unidentified bodies, but Israel refused and asked for the remains for examination.

title.children: Three bodies returned by Hamas are not those of hostages, Israel says

image.altText: A man in a suit looking at the camera and giving the thumbs up sign with both hands. A small cart is visible in the background.

props.synopsis: Isaac Stein should be at his day job as a lawyer for the Internal Revenue Service, but instead, he's making hot dogs as the US government shutdown drags on.

title.children: In Washington DC, a hot dog stall symbolises the US government shutdown

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's gains are immediate and personal while Xi Jinping's are quiet, reversible, and strategic

title.children: Silence was strategy, not oversight in Trump's meeting with Xi

image.altText: us president donald trump and canada prime minister mark carney.

props.synopsis: Canadian PM Mark Carney says he apologised to an "offended" US President Donald Trump over the ad, which led to trade talks being suspended and an additional 10 per cent tariff.

title.children: Canadian PM apologises to Trump over Reagan anti-tariff ad

image.altText: Baseball team run to the centre of the field to celebrate victory

props.synopsis: The Los Angeles Dodgers rallied to beat the Toronto Blue Jays 5-4 in extra innings of a decisive seventh game of the World Series to become Major League Baseball's first repeat champion in 25 years.

title.children: Dodgers win back-to-back World Series with epic comeback in game seven
